p: The most dangerous microbes for humans are those that are easily transmitted, virulent and invasive to the central organs like the blood and lung, robust survivors in the environment, have a low infection dose and are without any specific treatment or vaccine [ 2– 5]. Most of them are zoonosis transmitted from animals and often with insects as vectors [ 8– 12]. Dangerous microbes have also been used as biological weapons like anthrax, plague, botulism, Coxiella, Brucella, viral haemorrhagic fever (VHF) viruses, poxviruses and a number of other unusual agents [ 4, 13– 25]. In the United States, there was an anthrax bioterrorism attack in 2001 [ 18, 19].
